info.title: Security Insights
info.description: API spec for Microsoft.SecurityInsights (Azure Security Insights) resource provider

get.description: Lists all operations available Azure Security Insights Resource Provider.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.
Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates the alert rule.

put.description: Creates a watchlist and its watchlist items (bulk creation, e.g. through text/csv content type). To create a Watchlist and its Items, we should call this endpoint twice : the first call will create an empty Watchlist, and the second one will create its Items.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

subscriptionId.description: The subscription id to connect to, and get the data from.

aadTenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant id.

aadUserId.description: The Azure Active Directory user id.

accountName.description: The name of the account. This field should hold only the name without any domain added to it, i.e. administrator.

displayName.description: The display name of the account.

hostEntityId.description: The Host entity id that contains the account in case it is a local account (not domain joined)

isDomainJoined.description: Determines whether this is a domain account.

ntDomain.description: The NetBIOS domain name as it appears in the alert format – domain\username. Examples: NT AUTHORITY.

objectGuid.description: The objectGUID attribute is a single-value attribute that is the unique identifier for the object, assigned by active directory.

puid.description: The Azure Active Directory Passport User ID.

sid.description: The account security identifier, e.g. S-1-5-18.

upnSuffix.description: The user principal name suffix for the account, in some cases it is also the domain name. Examples: contoso.com.

dnsDomain.description: The fully qualified domain DNS name.

triggerUri.description: Logic App Callback URL for this specific workflow.

workflowId.description: The name of the logic app's workflow.

nextLink.description: URL to fetch the next set of actions.

connectorId.description: The connector id that provides the following data types

alertRulesCreatedByTemplateCount.description: the number of alert rules that were created by this template

lastUpdatedDateUTC.description: The last time that this alert rule template has been updated.

createdDateUTC.description: The time that this alert rule template has been added.

description.description: The description of the alert rule template.

displayName.description: The display name for alert rule template.

requiredDataConnectors.description: The required data sources for this template

resourceId.description: The azure resource id of the resource

subscriptionId.description: The subscription id of the resource

properties.description: Properties of aggregations results of cases.

CasesAggregationBySeverityProperties.description: Aggregative results of cases by severity property bag.

totalCriticalSeverity.description: Total amount of open cases with severity Critical

totalHighSeverity.description: Total amount of open cases with severity High

totalInformationalSeverity.description: Total amount of open cases with severity Informational

totalLowSeverity.description: Total amount of open cases with severity Low

totalMediumSeverity.description: Total amount of open cases with severity medium

CasesAggregationByStatusProperties.description: Aggregative results of cases by status property bag.

totalDismissedStatus.description: Total amount of closed cases with status Dismissed

totalInProgressStatus.description: Total amount of open cases with status InProgress

totalNewStatus.description: Total amount of open cases with status New

totalResolvedStatus.description: Total amount of closed cases with status Resolved

totalFalsePositiveStatus.description: Total amount of closed cases with status Closed and Close reason of False positive

totalTruePositiveStatus.description: Total amount of closed cases with status Closed and Close reason of True positive

CasesAggregationProperties.description: Aggregative results of cases property bag.

ClientInfo.description: Information on the client (user or application) that made some action

objectId.description: The object id of the client.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of the client.

appId.description: The technical identifier of the application.

appName.description: The name of the related cloud application.

instanceName.description: The user defined instance name of the cloud application. It is often used to distinguish between several applications of the same type that a customer has.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

kind.description: Describes the kind of connector to be checked.

DataConnectorAuthorizationState.description: Describes the state of user's authorization for a connector kind.

DataConnectorLicenseState.description: Describes the state of user's license for a connector kind.

DataConnectorDataTypeCommon.description: Common field for data type in data connectors.

state.description: Describe whether this data type connection is enabled or not.

dataTypes.description: The available data types for the connector.

domainName.description: The name of the dns record associated with the alert

hostIpAddressEntityId.description: An ip entity id for the dns request client

ipAddressEntityIds.description: Ip entity identifiers for the resolved ip address.

additionalData.description: A bag of custom fields that should be part of the entity and will be presented to the user.

friendlyName.description: The graph item display name which is a short humanly readable description of the graph item instance. This property is optional and might be system generated.

EntityQueryKind.description: Describes an Entity query resource with kind.

kind.description: The kind of the entity query

EntityQueryList.description: List of all the entity queries.

nextLink.description: URL to fetch the next set of entity queries.

ExpansionResultAggregation.description: Information of a specific aggregation in the expansion result.

aggregationType.description: The common type of the aggregation. (for e.g. entity field name)

count.description: Total number of aggregations of the given kind (and aggregationType if given) in the expansion result.

displayName.description: The display name of the aggregation by type.

entityKind.description: The kind of the aggregated entity.

aggregations.description: Information of the aggregated nodes in the expansion result.

dataSources.description: List of the data sources that are required to run the query

inputEntityType.description: The type of the query's source entity

inputFields.description: List of the fields of the source entity that are required to run the query

outputEntityTypes.description: List of the desired output types to be constructed from the result

queryTemplate.description: The template query string to be parsed and formatted

targetEntityId.description: Entity Id of the connected entity

additionalData.description: key-value pairs for a connected entity mapping

directory.description: The full path to the file.

fileHashEntityIds.description: The file hash entity identifiers associated with this file

fileName.description: The file name without path (some alerts might not include path).

hostEntityId.description: The Host entity id which the file belongs to

FusionAlertRuleProperties.description: Fusion alert rule base property bag.

description.description: The description of the alert rule.

displayName.description: The display name for alerts created by this alert rule.

enabled.description: Determines whether this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

lastModifiedUtc.description: The last time that this alert has been modified.

severity.description: The severity for alerts created by this alert rule.

alertRuleTemplateName.description: The Name of the alert rule template used to create this rule.

description.description: The description of the alert rule.

displayName.description: The display name for alerts created by this alert rule.

enabled.description: Determines whether this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

properties.description: Threat Intelligence alert rule template properties

severity.description: The severity for alerts created by this alert rule.

tactics.description: The tactics of the alert rule template

GeoLocation.description: The geo-location context attached to the ip entity

countryCode.description: The country code according to ISO 3166 format

countryName.description: Country name according to ISO 3166 Alpha 2: the lowercase of the English Short Name

latitude.description: The longitude of the identified location, expressed as a floating point number with range of -180 to 180, with positive numbers representing East and negative numbers representing West. Latitude and longitude are derived from the city or postal code.

longitude.description: The latitude of the identified location, expressed as a floating point number with range of - 90 to 90, with positive numbers representing North and negative numbers representing South. Latitude and longitude are derived from the city or postal code.

azureID.description: The azure resource id of the VM.

dnsDomain.description: The DNS domain that this host belongs to. Should contain the compete DNS suffix for the domain

hostName.description: The hostname without the domain suffix.

isDomainJoined.description: Determines whether this host belongs to a domain.

ntDomain.description: The NT domain that this host belongs to.

omsAgentID.description: The OMS agent id, if the host has OMS agent installed.

osVersion.description: A free text representation of the operating system. This field is meant to hold specific versions the are more fine grained than OSFamily or future values not supported by OSFamily enumeration

Incident.description: Represents an incident in Azure Security Insights.

created.description: The time the bookmark was created

createdBy.description: Describes a user that created the bookmark

displayName.description: The display name of the bookmark

labels.description: List of labels relevant to this bookmark

queryResult.description: The query result of the bookmark.

updated.description: The last time the bookmark was updated

updatedBy.description: Describes a user that updated the bookmark

incidentInfo.description: Describes an incident that relates to bookmark

alertsCount.description: The number of alerts in the incident

bookmarksCount.description: The number of bookmarks in the incident

commentsCount.description: The number of comments in the incident

alertProductNames.description: List of product names of alerts in the incident

nextLink.description: URL to fetch the next set of comments.

createdTimeUtc.description: The time the comment was created

lastModifiedTimeUtc.description: The time the comment was updated

author.description: Describes the client that created the comment

entities.description: Array of the incident related entities.

metaData.description: The metadata from the incident related entities results.

IncidentEntitiesResultsMetadata.description: Information of a specific aggregation in the incident related entities result.

count.description: Total number of aggregations of the given kind in the incident related entities result.

entityKind.description: The kind of the aggregated entity.

values.description: Label manually created by a user
Label automatically created by the system

nextLink.description: URL to fetch the next set of incidents.

IncidentOwnerInfo.description: Information on the user an incident is assigned to

email.description: The email of the user the incident is assigned to.

assignedTo.description: The name of the user the incident is assigned to.

objectId.description: The object id of the user the incident is assigned to.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of the user the incident is assigned to.

IncidentClassification.description: The reason the incident was closed

IncidentClassificationReason.description: The classification reason the incident was closed with

values.description: Classification reason was suspicious but expected
Classification reason was incorrect alert logic
An active incident which isn't being handled currently
An active incident which is being handled

classification.description: The reason the incident was closed

classificationComment.description: Describes the reason the incident was closed

classificationReason.description: The classification reason the incident was closed with

createdTimeUtc.description: The time the incident was created

firstActivityTimeUtc.description: The time of the first activity in the incident

incidentUrl.description: The deep-link url to the incident in Azure portal

labels.description: List of labels relevant to this incident

providerName.description: The name of the source provider that generated the incident

providerIncidentId.description: The incident ID assigned by the incident provider

lastActivityTimeUtc.description: The time of the last activity in the incident

lastModifiedTimeUtc.description: The last time the incident was updated

owner.description: Describes a user that the incident is assigned to

relatedAnalyticRuleIds.description: List of resource ids of Analytic rules related to the incident

address.description: The IP address as string, e.g. 127.0.0.1 (either in Ipv4 or Ipv6)

location.description: The geo-location context attached to the ip entity

threatIntelligence.description: A list of TI contexts attached to the ip entity.

Label.description: Label that will be used to tag and filter on.

externalDirectoryObjectId.description: The AzureAD identifier of mailbox. Similar to AadUserId in account entity but this property is specific to mailbox object on office side

networkMessageIds.description: The mail message IDs that are part of the mail cluster

countByDeliveryStatus.description: Count of mail messages by DeliveryStatus string representation

countByThreatType.description: Count of mail messages by ThreatType string representation

countByProtectionStatus.description: Count of mail messages by ProtectionStatus string representation

threats.description: The threats of mail messages that are part of the mail cluster

query.description: The query that was used to identify the messages of the mail cluster

mailCount.description: The number of mail messages that are part of the mail cluster

isVolumeAnomaly.description: Is this a volume anomaly mail cluster

source.description: The source of the mail cluster (default is 'O365 ATP')

clusterSourceIdentifier.description: The id of the cluster source

clusterSourceType.description: The type of the cluster source

fileEntityIds.description: The File entity ids of this mail message's attachments

recipient.description: The recipient of this mail message. Note that in case of multiple recipients the mail message is forked and each copy has one recipient

urls.description: The Urls contained in this mail message

items.description: A Url contained in this mail message

threats.description: The threats of this mail message

items.description: A threat of the mail message

receiveDate.description: The receive date of this message

networkMessageId.description: The network message id of this mail message

internetMessageId.description: The internet message id of this mail message

subject.description: The subject of this mail message

language.description: The language of this mail message

antispamDirection.description: The directionality of this mail message

deliveryAction.description: The delivery action of this mail message like Delivered, Blocked, Replaced etc

deliveryLocation.description: The delivery location of this mail message like Inbox, JunkFolder etc

networkMessageId.description: The network message id of email to which submission belongs

timestamp.description: The Time stamp when the message is received (Mail)

reportType.description: The submission type for the given instance. This maps to Junk, Phish, Malware or NotJunk.

category.description: The malware category by the vendor, e.g. Trojan

fileEntityIds.description: List of linked file entity identifiers on which the malware was found

malwareName.description: The malware name by the vendor, e.g. Win32/Toga!rfn

processEntityIds.description: List of linked process entity identifiers on which the malware was found.

displayNamesFilter.description: the alerts' displayNames on which the cases will be generated

displayNamesExcludeFilter.description: the alerts' displayNames on which the cases will not be generated

productFilter.description: The alerts' productName on which the cases will be generated

severitiesFilter.description: the alerts' severities on which the cases will be generated

OperationsList.description: Lists the operations available in the SecurityInsights RP.

nextLink.description: URL to fetch the next set of operations.

accountEntityId.description: The account entity id running the processes.

commandLine.description: The command line used to create the process

creationTimeUtc.description: The time when the process started to run

elevationToken.description: The elevation token associated with the process.

hostEntityId.description: The host entity id on which the process was running

hostLogonSessionEntityId.description: The session entity id in which the process was running

hive.description: the hive that holds the registry key.

valueData.description: String formatted representation of the value data.

valueType.description: Specifies the data types to use when storing values in the registry, or identifies the data type of a value in the registry.

nextLink.description: URL to fetch the next set of relations.

Relation.description: Represents a relation between two resources

relatedResourceId.description: The resource ID of the related resource

relatedResourceName.description: The name of the related resource

relatedResourceType.description: The resource type of the related resource

relatedResourceKind.description: The resource kind of the related resource

ResourceWithEtag.description: An azure resource object with an Etag property

ScheduledAlertRuleCommonProperties.description: Scheduled alert rule template property bag.

query.description: The query that creates alerts for this rule.

queryFrequency.description: The frequency (in ISO 8601 duration format) for this alert rule to run.

queryPeriod.description: The period (in ISO 8601 duration format) that this alert rule looks at.

severity.description: The severity for alerts created by this alert rule.

triggerOperator.description: The operation against the threshold that triggers alert rule.

triggerThreshold.description: The threshold triggers this alert rule.

ScheduledAlertRuleProperties.description: Scheduled alert rule base property bag.

alertRuleTemplateName.description: The Name of the alert rule template used to create this rule.

description.description: The description of the alert rule.

displayName.description: The display name for alerts created by this alert rule.

enabled.description: Determines whether this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

lastModifiedUtc.description: The last time that this alert rule has been modified.

suppressionDuration.description: The suppression (in ISO 8601 duration format) to wait since last time this alert rule been triggered.

suppressionEnabled.description: Determines whether the suppression for this alert rule is enabled or disabled.

tactics.description: The tactics of the alert rule

incidentConfiguration.description: The settings of the incidents that created from alerts triggered by this analytics rule

tactics.description: The tactics of the alert rule template

createIncident.description: Create incidents from alerts triggered by this analytics rule

groupingConfiguration.description: Set how the alerts that are triggered by this analytics rule, are grouped into incidents

lookbackDuration.description: Limit the group to alerts created within the lookback duration (in ISO 8601 duration format)

values.description: Grouping alerts into a single incident if all the entities match
Grouping all alerts triggered by this rule into a single incident
Grouping alerts into a single incident if the selected entities match

groupByEntities.description: A list of entity types to group by (when entitiesMatchingMethod is Custom)

alertDisplayName.description: The display name of the alert.

alertType.description: The type name of the alert.

compromisedEntity.description: Display name of the main entity being reported on.

confidenceLevel.description: The confidence level of this alert.

values.description: Unknown confidence, the is the default value
Low confidence, meaning we have some doubts this is indeed malicious or part of an attack
High confidence that the alert is true positive malicious

confidenceScore.description: The confidence score of the alert.

confidenceScoreStatus.description: The confidence score calculation status, i.e. indicating if score calculation is pending for this alert, not applicable or final.

values.description: Score will not be calculated for this alert as it is not supported by virtual analyst
No score was set yet and calculation is in progress
Score is calculated and shown as part of the alert, but may be updated again at a later time following the processing of additional data
Final score was calculated and available

endTimeUtc.description: The impact end time of the alert (the time of the last event contributing to the alert).

intent.description: Holds the alert intent stage(s) mapping for this alert.

values.description: Probing could be an attempt to access a certain resource regardless of a malicious intent or a failed attempt to gain access to a target system to gather information prior to exploitation. This step is usually detected as an attempt originating from outside the network in attempt to scan the target system and find a way in.

Exploitation is the stage where an attacker manage to get foothold on the attacked resource. This stage is applicable not only for compute hosts, but also for resources such as user accounts, certificates etc. Adversaries will often be able to control the resource after this stage.

Persistence is any access, action, or configuration change to a system that gives an adversary a persistent presence on that system. Adversaries will often need to maintain access to systems through interruptions such as system restarts, loss of credentials, or other failures that would require a remote access tool to restart or alternate backdoor for them to regain access.

Privilege escalation is the result of actions that allow an adversary to obtain a higher level of permissions on a system or network. Certain tools or actions require a higher level of privilege to work and are likely necessary at many points throughout an operation. User accounts with permissions to access specific systems or perform specific functions necessary for adversaries to achieve their objective may also be considered an escalation of privilege.

Defense evasion consists of techniques an adversary may use to evade detection or avoid other defenses. Sometimes these actions are the same as or variations of techniques in other categories that have the added benefit of subverting a particular defense or mitigation.

Credential access represents techniques resulting in access to or control over system, domain, or service credentials that are used within an enterprise environment. Adversaries will likely attempt to obtain legitimate credentials from users or administrator accounts (local system administrator or domain users with administrator access) to use within the network. With sufficient access within a network, an adversary can create accounts for later use within the environment.

Discovery consists of techniques that allow the adversary to gain knowledge about the system and internal network. When adversaries gain access to a new system, they must orient themselves to what they now have control of and what benefits operating from that system give to their current objective or overall goals during the intrusion. The operating system provides many native tools that aid in this post-compromise information-gathering phase.

Lateral movement consists of techniques that enable an adversary to access and control remote systems on a network and could, but does not necessarily, include execution of tools on remote systems. The lateral movement techniques could allow an adversary to gather information from a system without needing additional tools, such as a remote access tool. An adversary can use lateral movement for many purposes, including remote Execution of tools, pivoting to additional systems, access to specific information or files, access to additional credentials, or to cause an effect.

The execution tactic represents techniques that result in execution of adversary-controlled code on a local or remote system. This tactic is often used in conjunction with lateral movement to expand access to remote systems on a network.

Collection consists of techniques used to identify and gather information, such as sensitive files, from a target network prior to exfiltration. This category also covers locations on a system or network where the adversary may look for information to exfiltrate.

Exfiltration refers to techniques and attributes that result or aid in the adversary removing files and information from a target network. This category also covers locations on a system or network where the adversary may look for information to exfiltrate.
The command and control tactic represents how adversaries communicate with systems under their control within a target network.

The impact intent primary objective is to directly reduce the availability or integrity of a system, service, or network; including manipulation of data to impact a business or operational process. This would often refer to techniques such as ransom-ware, defacement, data manipulation and others.

providerAlertId.description: The identifier of the alert inside the product which generated the alert.

processingEndTime.description: The time the alert was made available for consumption.

productComponentName.description: The name of a component inside the product which generated the alert.

status.description: The lifecycle status of the alert.
